poem:
Title: "A Jazz Odyssey"

Cobbled from the Chicago streets  
sprouted jazz, a fierce heart beat.  
Invention crisp as shattered glass,  
the AACM's uncompromising brass.  

Unfamiliar, yet resonant deep,  
tradition's vow they chose to keep.  
In every note, a joyous brawl,  
a pugnacious communal call.

Abrams, Braxton, and Henry the stars, 
conversing in their avant-jazz bars.
Their music, life's vivid stencil,
child of passion, born parental.
